title: aurebesh
body:
A fictional writing system from the [[Star Wars]] franchise.

[b]Aurebesh[/b] was a writing system commonly used to represent the Basic language used across the known [[galaxy]] in the Star Wars saga. The name came from a combination of the first two letters, Aurek and Besh. 

Aurebesh implemented consonants, vowels, digraphs, and punctuation marks. Words were separated by spaces. Aurebesh could be written mainly left-to-right or up-to-down. All letters are the same relative size, although occasionally symbols were mirror-inverted to denote capital letters. The symbol for the Republic Credit was a Resh (R for Republic) with two vertical lines through the upper half of the symbol. Letters of the alphabet were also used to denote musical keys, such as the key of Cresh.

title: yosuga_no_sora
body:
[b]Yosuga no Sora[/b] is a bishoujo eroge game by Sphere, first released in 2008. Known as "Yosusora" for short. Illustrated by [[Hashimoto Takashi]] and [[Suzuhira Hiro]]. The franchise also includes a 2010 manga and a 2010 softcore TV anime.

(In)famous for setting up the precedent of the [[siscon]]-[[brocon]] anime trope that later became something of a norm (though much toned down in mainstream media compared to the series' outright [[incest]]ous themes).

h4. Characters

h6. Main characters

* [[Amatsume Akira]]
* [[Kasugano Haruka]] (the male protagonist)
* [[Kasugano Sora]]
* [[Migiwa Kazuha]]
* [[Nogisaka Motoka]]
* [[Yorihime Nao]]

h6. Supporting characters

* [[Ifukube Yahiro]]
* [[Kuranaga Kozue]]
* [[Nakazato Ryouhei]]

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]], and [[green eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a [[serafuku]] consisting of a [[black shirt]] with [[black sailor collar]], [[crescent hair ornament]], [[black skirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[grey footwear|grey shoes]].

title: kamen_rider_birth
body:
Secondary Rider of [[kamen_rider_ooo_(series)|Kamen Rider OOO]].

[[date_akira|Date Akira]] is a world traveler who, upon returning to Japan in order to fund his next adventure, was hired by the Kougami Foundation to become the first wielder of their Birth Driver.
Unlike [[kamen_rider_ooo|OOO]] who uses Core Medals, Birth transforms by way of the expendable but very common Cell Medals, which also double as ammo for his Birth Buster or "payment" for Birth CLAWs, an armament system contained within [[gashapon]]-like Receptacle Orbs located throughout his armor. Later in the series Akira leaves Japan, and during this period [[gotou_shintarou|Gotou Shintarou]] takes over as Kamen Rider Birth.

title: gear_third
body:
One of [[Monkey D. Luffy]]'s transformations from [[One Piece]].

Luffy corks his mouth with his thumb, bites into his thumb joint (making a small opening) and blows very hard into it, which inflates his arm. He is then able to transfer the air through his entire body, requiring the torso to act as an interface for his various limbs. Luffy blows so much air into his body that when they are all focused on a single limb, they become the size equivalent to (or greater than) that of a giant's, if anything resembling [[oars_(one_piece)|Oars']] size.

title: gear_second
body:
One of [[Monkey D. Luffy]]'s transformations from [[One Piece]].

Luffy activates it by using his legs as a pump to expand his blood vessels, which allows oxygen to get to his muscles much faster. When this happens, the blood flowing rapidly through his body creates friction, heating up his body and makes his skin glow and produce steam. This increases his attack power and overall speed, but drains his stamina and if overused makes him temporarily unable to move afterward, as well as shortening his life span.

title: candy
body:
Candy, specifically sugar candy, is a confection made from a concentrated solution of sugar in water, to which flavorings and colorants are added. Candies come in numerous colors and varieties and have a long history in popular culture. Outside the United States, it is referred to as "sweets" or "confectioneries."

For the [[Smile Precure!]] character, see [[Candy (Smile Precure!)]].

title: honzuki_no_gekokujou
body:
[[Honzuki no Gekokujou]] is an isekai fantasy series. The main protagonist is a hopeless book lover who unexpectedly dies and gets reincarnated in a fantasy world as a young girl named [[Myne (honzuki no gekokujou)|Myne]]. The only problem is that there are no books! And thus begins her relentless efforts to reinvent books in that world and spread the joy of reading to those around her!

The series started as a web novel by Kazuki Miya and was later published as a regular light novel. The novel itself is completed, but there is both a manga serialization and an anime adaption which are both ongoing.


h4.Characters
h5.Protagonist

title: madougushi_dahlia_wa_utsumukanai
body:
[i]Madougushi Dahlia wa Utsumukanai: Kyou kara Jiyuu na Shokunin Raifu[/i] (魔導具師ダリヤはうつむかない ～今日から自由な職人ライフ～) is a 2018-to-Present romance isekai light novel series by Amagishi Hisaya and illustrated by Kei.  It has been adapted into two manga adaptations and an anime adaptation has been announced in the works.  The series has two official English titles with the light novel titled [i]Dahlia in Bloom: Crafting a Fresh Start with Magical Tools[/i], or simply [i]Dahlia in Bloom[/i], and the second manga titled [i]Magic Artisan Dahlia Wilts No More[/i].

The story follows the female protagonist Dahlia Rossetti, a magical toolmaker who has just recently befallen unfortunate events.  Her father, a famous magical toolmaker, just recently passed away and shortly before she was to move in with her fiancée, he informs her he wishes to annul their engagement as he has fallen in love with another woman.  As their engagement had been arranged by their deceased fathers' and was not out of romantic feelings, she agrees though still feels betrayed. She had done a lot to conform to her fiancée's wishes of an ideal woman and thought time together would bridge their feelings.  Wanting to move on, she vows against future romance and to instead focus on crafting tools; a long cherished dream that she held even from her previous life in Japan.  During one of her outings to collect crafting materials she happens to meet an injured knight and their meeting would greatly change her life.

title: kamen_rider_meteor
body:
Secondary Rider of [[Kamen Rider Fourze (series)|Kamen Rider Fourze]].

His real name is [[Sakuta Ryuusei|Sakuta Ryusei]], a member of the Anti-Zodiarts Union who also doubles as the rival and eventual friend of [[Kisaragi Gentarou|Kisaragi Gentaro]] and [[Kamen Rider Fourze]].

Unlike Fourze, his powers come from the M-BUS [[satellite]] [[space station]] in Earth's orbit above Japan, which holds necessary energy for Meteor to transform. Cosmic Energy is received to complete Kamen Rider Meteor's transformation.

However, if Ryusei is not exposed to this energy, he is not able to transform. After transforming into Kamen Rider Meteor, he says "Kamen Rider Meteor, your fate is mine to decide!", though [[Joujima Yuki|Yuki]] will yell out "The Meteor is Here!" everytime Meteor arrives in his blue fireball form. His helmet is called the Star Face.

By swapping the Meteor Storm Switch with the Meteor Switch in the Meteor Driver, then spin the fan on the Switch after activating it, he can transform into the stronger Kamen Rider Meteor Storm, gaining in both power and speed. After changing into Kamen Rider Meteor Storm, Ryusei says "Kamen Rider Meteor Storm, my fate will deliver a storm!". His helmet is upgraded into the "Starlight Face".

In this form, he gain the access to a new weapon, the Meteor Storm Shaft, which is a gun rod-like weapon.

title: winchester_model_1887
body:
The [b]Winchester Model 1887[/b] is a [[lever action]] [[shotgun]] designed by [[john moses browning|John Browning]] and produced by the Winchester Repeating Arms Company, maker of the famous [[Winchester model 1873|Winchester rifles]]. It was one of the first successful repeating shotgun designs, but was done so before the proliferation of smokeless gunpowder, which proved too powerful for the design to contain. In addition, [[pump action]] shotguns proved more popular for the new gunpowder mixture, and after the advent of the [[Winchester Model 1897]], interest in the older model quickly waned. 

The Model 1887 was saved from relative obscurity, however, by its use in the 1991 movie [[Terminator 2: Judgment Day]], after which the [[weapon]] and the distinctive flip maneuver used to rechamber it became cultural icons. In Anime, the Model 1887 is recognized for its use by [[tsurugi (blue archive)|Tsurugi]] and [[mine (blue archive)|Mine]] in [[Blue Archive]], though even these tend to be done as references themselves to Terminator.

title: heattech_leotard
body:
A [[meme attire|meme outfit]] consisting of a [[turtleneck leotard]] made of a ribbed material resembling a sweater. The outfit is sold by [[Uniqlo]] and is made of HeatTech, a thin material designed to wick away moisture and hold body heat. The outfit comes in [[red leotard|red]], [[black leotard|black]], or [[grey leotard|grey]].

The leotards worn by the [[Shadaloo Dolls]] are visually similar except for the neckties, but they should not be referred as such due to the difference in colors as well as overall design. The leotard as sold by Uniqlo is not a thong leotard and does not have the backless design. Furthermore, it is secured by buttons at the crotch.

This tag used to be referred to as "[[turtleneck leotard]]," but the ambiguity of the tag name led to it being populated by images with literal turtleneck leotards and not necessarily the HeatTech one, thus the need for the rename.

* !asset #24772131

title: vulcan
body:
A fictional humanoid [[alien]] race from the [[Star Trek]] series. They all have straight [[black hair]], [[pointy ears]] and funny eyebrows. 

[b]Vulcans[/b] were one of the first intelligent alien races that made contact with the human race. They are an important part of the [i]United Federation of Planets[/i] and helped to create it with the humans and many other pacific alien races.

Vulcans value logic, harmony, intelligence and serenity above everything else. However, despite their pacifist nature and culture they have super human strength, are very well trained in personal self-defense and can be very smart and highly capable warriors when the situation requires it. They also have very long lifespans.

In their past, Vulcans and [[Romulan]]s shared the same origins and both originated from a barbaric and war-mongering race. As time passed the Vulcan culture changed and evolved into a very intelectual and logic ridden peaceful species. The Romulan race, however, continued with its war-like tendencies.

h4.See also

* [[Spock]]
* [[Vulcan salute]]

title: taoism
body:
[b]Taoism[/b] (/ˈdaʊɪzəm/), also known as [b]Daoism[/b], is a religious or philosophical tradition of Chinese origin which emphasizes living in harmony with the [i]Tao[/i] (道, literally "Way", also romanized as [i]Dao[/i]). 

The Tao is a fundamental idea in most Chinese philosophical schools; in Taoism, however, it denotes the principle that is both the source, pattern and substance of everything that exists.

Taoism differs from Confucianism by not emphasizing rigid rituals and social order.

Taoist ethics vary depending on the particular school, but in general tend to emphasize [i]wu wei[/i] (effortless action), "naturalness", simplicity, spontaneity, and the Three Treasures: 慈 "compassion", 儉 "frugality", and 不敢為天下先 "humility".

title: pc_engine
body:
The NEC [b]PC Engine[/b] (PCエンジン [i]Pī Shī Enjin[/i]), known in the west as the [b]TurboGrafx-16 Entertainment SuperSystem[/b], is a [[video game]] console joint-developed by [[Hudson]] Soft and [[NEC Corporation]], released in Japan on October 30, 1987, and in the United States on August 19, 1989. It was the first console released in the 16-bit era, albeit still utilizing an 8-bit CPU. Originally intended to "beat" the Nintendo [[Famicom]] (which it achieved in Japan), it ended up competing against the likes of the [[Sega Mega Drive]], [[Super Famicom]], and even the [[Neo Geo]] AES.

The TurboGrafx-16 has an 8-bit CPU and a dual 16-bit GPU; and is capable of displaying 482 colors simultaneously, out of 512. With dimensions of 14 cm×14 cm×3.8 cm (5.5 in×5.5 in×1.5 in), [b]the NEC PC Engine holds the record for the world's smallest game console ever made[/b].

In the United Kingdom, Telegames released a slightly altered version of the American model simply as the TurboGrafx around 1990 in extremely limited quantities. Although there was no full-scale PAL region release of the system, imported PC Engine consoles were largely available in France and Benelux through major retailers thanks to the unlicensed importer Sodipeng (Société de Distribution de la PC Engine, a subsidiary of Guillemot International).

In Japan, the PC Engine was very successful. It gained strong third-party support and outsold the Famicom at its 1987 debut, eventually becoming the Super Famicom's main rival. However, the TurboGrafx-16 failed to break into the North American market and sold poorly, which has been blamed on the delayed release and inferior marketing. 

At least 17 distinct models of the console were made, including portable versions and those that integrated the CD-ROM add-on. An enhanced model, the PC Engine SuperGrafx, was rushed to market in 1989. It featured many performance enhancements and was intended to supersede the standard PC Engine. It failed to catch on—only six titles were released that took advantage of the added power and it was quickly discontinued. The final model was discontinued in 1994. 

Two major revisions, the [[PC Engine SuperGrafx]] and the PC Engine Duo, were released in 1989 and 1991, respectively. The entire series was succeed by the unsuccessful PC-FX in 1994, which was only released in Japan after the TurboGrafx-16 and its revised variants failed to gain enough market share in North America.

Note that this tag is for a game console. For a personal computer (PC), use [[computer]] instead.

h4. See also
* [[List of game consoles]]

title: agent_spider
body:
[b]Agent Spider[/b] is a fictional superhero from the animated series [[Invincible (series)|]]. The character is an expy of the [[Marvel]] superhero [[Spider-Man]], as a nod to the crossover the two comicbook series had. However, due to licensing issues, Spider-Man couldn't appear in the Invincible animated series which led to the creation of Agent Spider.

Agent Spider is voiced by Josh Keaton, who previously voiced Spider-Man in The Spectacular Spider-Man cartoon.

title: chopper_crying_(meme)
body:
[b]Chopper Crying[/b] is a viral image of the character [[Tony Tony Chopper|Chopper]] from [[One Piece]] [[crying]] in the snow with visible breath coming from his mouth.

It became popularized as a reaction image and a source of redraws and ironic [[meme|memes]] in 2022 in connection with the virality of the [[The One Piece Is Real (meme)|One Piece Is Real]] and One Piece Cock Edit memes.

h4. See also
* "Chopper Crying on KnowYourMeme.com":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/chopper-crying]

title: the_one_piece_is_real_(meme)
body:
A bait-and-switch [[meme]], originally featuring a [[nude filter]] screencap of [[Edward Newgate]] from [[One Piece]], accompanied by his [spoiler]last[/spoiler] words "The One Piece!!.... The One Piece is real!!!" (referring to the eponymous treasure of the series).

The meme later includes various nude filters of other male characters from the series, along with being combined with [[chopper crying (meme)|a meme of]] [[Tony Tony Chopper]] [[crying]] at the end as a stand-in for the viewer's reaction after having seen the image.

The meme is accompanied by the song ""Dark Fantasy":[https://youtu.be/UTH1VNHLjng?t=23]" by Kanye West, specifically the part that samples the lyrics of the 1983 song ""In High Places":[https://youtu.be/oIWZ4dqKmJs?t=50]" by Mike Oldfield, giving rise to the meme's alternate name of "Can we get much higher?".

This tag is applicable when the image references any one of the nude filter images used in the meme.

title: adeptus_custodes
body:
The Adeptus Custodes, renowned as the Golden Legion, the Brotherhood of Demigods, the Golden Brotherhood, and a host of other titles (The Custodian Guard, The Guardians, the Emperor’s Saints, the Watchers of The Throne, The Thousand Companions, The Ten Thousand), but most commonly known as Custodians, are the guardians of the Imperial Palace and the Golden Throne, as well as the personal bodyguard to the [[emperor_of_mankind|Emperor]]. Due to the vast size of the Imperial Palace, the Custodes always act as a defensive army.

Together with the [[anathema_psykana|Sisters of Silence]], they represented the Talons of the Emperor as the right hand of the Emperor. Custodians are the mightiest of mankind's warriors. They are to the Space Marines what those transhuman warriors are to common Guardsmen, an elevated elite whose raw strength and willpower are wholly insurmountable.

title: kiseijou_rei
body:
A antagonist from [[Kami Jigen Game Neptune V]], representing the [[Atari 2600]]. At first, she appears as an adorable, cute, beautiful but clumsy dork who tries to create a world without CPUs by spending her nights writing papers and passing them down.
She has light blue hair, a single horn in her human form, and has glasses.
[spoiler]And her HDD form, she has a leotard, loses the glasses, gain a second horn, and a slasher smile.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]She receives the power from her alternative self who was a CPU, go crazy, tries to destroy Gamindustri, succeeds in doing so unless the player wins, and has to clean Planeptune. By herself.[/spoiler]

She has an alternative Ultradimension self.
[spoiler]Her other self is a former CPU who was in charge of Tari (a reference to Atari), has her land crashing in flame (a reference to the Video Game Crash) and disappearing underground (a reference to all the ET cartridges buried in New Mexico desert), and is also an adorable, cute, beautiful but clumsy dork. On top of being a bit insane and a complete virgin who never held a boy's hand.[/spoiler]

She also appears in the anime.
[spoiler]In that one, she ends up in jail.[/spoiler]

Voiced by: [[Kobayashi Yuu]] (Japanese), Julie Ann Taylor (English, games), Morgan Garrett (English, anime)

title: isis-chan
body:
[[Personification]] of the [[terrorist]] organisation [[ISIS (terrorist group)|]] ([i]The Islamic State of Iraq and Syria[/i]).

She was made at "”ISISを萌え美少女化してイスラムの奴らに送りつけようずｗｗｗｗｗｗ”":http://viper.2ch.net/test/read.cgi/news4vip/1422098539/ (Let's make a moe personification of ISIS and send her to Muslim guys. LOLLOLLOLLOL) threads of [[2channel]]'s "News for VIP" Board. The first project/thread started on January 24, 2015.

After ISIS kidnapped and killed a Japanese journalist in 2014 and various brutal images of ISIS victims spread on Google Japan, Japanese artists started to draw gags and images of ISIS-chan in order to flood Google Images search results of ISIS in Japan. However, several rules for drawing ISIS-chan were created to prevent controversy in the future.

h5. Rules and Guidelines about creating ISIS-chan content.
1. Content must not be sexually suggestive and/or explicit.
2. Content must not contain violence.
3. Content must not contain racism.

h5. Profile

Name: ISIS-chan
Pronunciation of the name: Aishisu-chan (アイシスちゃん)
Costume: Black (like ISIS’s uniforms) 
Hairstyle: [[short_hair|Short]]
Hair color: [[black_hair|Black]] (but most Japanese artists draw her with [[green hair]])
Age: 19
Color of skin: [[dark_skin|Brown]]

title: yayoi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Yayoi[/i]. Character design by [[Kusada Souta]], voiced by [[Hidaka Rina]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]] with [[short_hair_with_long_locks|long locks]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a [[serafuku]] consisting of a [[black shirt]] with [[black sailor collar]], [[crescent hair ornament]], [[purple ribbon|purple]] [[neck ribbon]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] with white stripes, and [[grey footwear|grey shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the class: her funnel and foremast to her back (with a flower attached), a 12 cm [[handgun]] mount (with Kisaragi's hair ribbon on the barrel), and two 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. 

She frequently has a sour face and a deadpan regard for what's going on around her.

The historical [i]Yayoi[/i] was sunk by air attack on September 11, 1942, off New Guinea.

title: yellow_magic_orchestra
body:
A Japanese electronic music band formed in 1978 by Haruomi Hosono, Ryuichi Sakamoto, and Yukihiro Takahashi. A pioneer in the use of synthesizers, samplers, and sequencers, the band helped define the synthpop, technopop, and electro genres.

h4. See also

* [[Solid State Survivor]]: second album of Yellow Magic Orchestra

title: solid_state_survivor
body: [[Yellow Magic Orchestra]]'s second album, one of the band's most iconic works, featuring more refined and accessible sound, solidifying Japanese technopop. Standout tracks include "Rydeen", which was performed in [[Hibike! Euphonium]] and rearranged in [[Highly Responsive to Prayers]] as Strange Oriental Discourse, and "Technopolis", which served as the basis for the track Solid State Scouter in [[Dragon Ball Z]]'s [[Bardock]] special.

title: frankensteiner
body:
The Frankensteiner is a professional [[wrestling]] move. It was named by Scott Steiner who used it as a finishing move.

The recipient of the move stands upright as the attacker jumps on their shoulders from the front, facing the opposite direction so that the recipient's face would be in the attacker's gut and the attacker's legs would be hanging over the back. Then the attacker does a back flip, landing on their head and arms and dragging the recipient over in the process. The recipient lands on their head or neck.

title: battle_of_britain
body:
[quote][i]"Never in the field of human conflict was so much owed by so many to so few...":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Never_was_so_much_owed_by_so_many_to_so_few[/i] - British Prime Minister [[Winston Churchill]] describing the ongoing battle.[/quote] 

[b]The Battle of Britain[/b] (German: [i]Die Luftschlacht um England[/i], "The Air Battle for England") was a [[military]] campaign of [[World War II]], in which the outnumbered [[Royal Air Force]] (RAF) and the Fleet Air Arm (FAA) of the Royal Navy successfully defended the [[United Kingdom]] (UK) against large-scale attacks by Nazi Germany's (then) massive air force, the [[Luftwaffe]]. 

The battle took place a month after the [[Dunkirk Evacuation]]. It was the first step before the intended subsequent invasion of Britain by the Germans ([i]"Operation Sea Lion":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Sea_Lion[/i]).

The battle was the first major military campaign fought entirely by air forces. The RAF was also supported by several squadrons of Polish pilots who escaped to Britain after the conquest of [[Poland]] by Nazi Germany. The British officially recognise the battle's duration as being from 10 July until 31 October 1940, which overlaps the period of large-scale night attacks known as [b]the Blitz[/b], that lasted from 7 September 1940 to 11 May 1941.

The battle ended with a British victory after they regained air superiority over the island. The failure of the Luftwaffe to subdue the UK along with the beginning of the invasion of the Soviet Union resulted into a cancellation of the planned invasion of Britain, allowing the UK and western allies to refocus their war effort to the North Africa campaign.

title: atomic_bombings_of_hiroshima_and_nagasaki
body:
Referring to the [b]Atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki[/b], a [[nuclear_weapon|nuclear bomb]] attack on [[japan|Japanese]] cities of [[Hiroshima]] and [[Nagasaki]] by the [[United States]] to end [[World War II]].

The large numbers of American casualties in the battles of [[Iwo Jima]] and [[battle_of_okinawa|Okinawa]], Japan's refusal to surrender and the projected casualties during "the upcoming invasion of the Japanese home islands":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Downfall (which some experts considered to be as high as a million dead or injured American soldiers) were some of the arguments in favor of these operations.

The first attack was carried out in 6 August 1945 on Hiroshima and second attack on Nagasaki in 9 August 1945. Resulted in over 200,000 deaths. 

It remains the first and only time in the history of the human race that atomic weapons were ever used in warfare.

h4. See Also
* [[B-29 Superfortress]]

* [[Hiroshima Peace Memorial]]

title: white_flag
body:
A white flag is a flag with solid white color. Used as a sign of [[surrendering|truce]], often as a request for negotiation. The white flag is popularly known as a symbol of surrender. In racing it can mean "slow moving vehicle ahead" for [[federation_internationale_de_l'automobile|FIA]]-sanctioned races or "final lap" for [[IndyCar Series|IndyCar]] and [[NASCAR]].

title: sagohzo_(ooo_combo)
body:
One of [[Kamen Rider OOO]]'s combos, accessed via the Rhino (Sai), Gorilla, and Elephant (Zou) Core Medals.

OOO now gains superhuman strength, [[earth (element)|earth]] control and gravity manipulation as well the ability to perform strong headbutts through the Sai Head, the Bagoon Pressure attack by firing the Gori Bagoon gauntlets from the Gorilla Arms, and also create powerful shockwaves by banging his chest through the Gorilla Arms, and cause minor earthquakes with the Zou Legs, including a powerful drop attack called the Zuo Stomp.

Although Sagohzo Combo is the toughest and strongest of the first five Full Combos, its jumping height is considered to be weaker and it has the slowest running speed. His Scanning Charge is the Sagohzo Impact, where OOO manipulates gravity to lift him into the air and weights himself down to hit the ground with a powerful stomp, trapping an enemy in the ground that forms around it while the reformed ground moves toward OOO where he delivers a powerful double-handed punch and headbutt at the same time.

title: shauta_(ooo_combo)
body:
One of [[Kamen Rider OOO]]'s combos, accessed via the Orca (Shachi), Eel (Unagi), and Octopus (Tako) Core Medals.

OOO now excels in [[underwater]] [[battle|battles]] and gains the ability to liquefy his body like [[Kamen Rider BLACK RX]] as the Bio Rider. He is armed with the Denki Unagi Whips which enable [[electricity|electrically]] charged attacks, the most powerful being the Voltarm Whip. The Tako Legs allow OOO Shauta to climb walls with their suction cup-like abilities and can split apart for a barrage of hits. Although Shauta is better well-suited for underwater combat, it's also very weaker than the other combos due to its punching and kicking power, but it has fantastic flexibility. He can also perform an echolocation via the Shachi Head.

His Scanning Charge is the Octo Banish, where OOO liquefies his lower body to propel himself upward, then use the Unagi Whips to drag the opponent upward while OOO goes back down using the Tako Legs to form a [[drill]] to burst through the opponent.

title: kamen_rider_ooo
body:
Titular Rider of [[Kamen Rider OOO (series)|]], twenty-first show of the Kamen Rider series and twelfth of the Heisei generation.

[[Hino Eiji]] is a world-traveling vagrant with no long-term job, whose recent stint as a museum guard drags him into a tournament between the Greeed, five creatures competing for the title of "Multi King" after an 800-year-slumber. Finding himself an unwitting pawn of the bird-type Greeed Ankh, Eiji fights the Yummy, monsters materialized by Greeed from human desires and which serve as their pawns, as Kamen Rider OOO.
Like [[Kamen Rider Double|his immediate predecessor]], OOO takes on various Combos by placing three Core Medals ([[O Medal]]s taken from the Greeed) at once on his OOO Driver, his default Combo being the [[TaToBa (OOO Combo)|TaToBa (Hawk/Tiger/Grasshopper) Combo]].

title: eve_(eversoul)
body:
A Demon-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]]. [spoiler]She was originally an Angel-type Soul until a certain unfortunate event.[/spoiler]
CV: Lee Hyeon-jin (Korean)
[hr]
The very first Soul given physical form by Dr. Angelica Faust [spoiler](at least on record)[/spoiler]. She is a highly-intellectual Soul with the unfortunate innate ability to beguile those who lay their eyes upon her, regardless of gender. Due to this, all the powerful Souls created by humanity were based on her image, leading to the rarity of male Souls in general. [spoiler]When Faust refused to give up Eve after humanity's desire for her remained unabated, they created an excuse for them to forcibly capture and corrupt her as Eve once attempted to create one of her own kind. When even the corruption of Eve wasn't enough, worldwide tensions escalated up until World War III was unleashed and the apocalyptic Apollyon was summoned, leading to the demise of mankind on Earth.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]She is also one of two primordial Souls created by the Transcendents to watch over and ensure the world's eternal recurrence alongside her "sibling" [[Dark Knight (Eversoul)|Adam]].[/spoiler]

In Eden, her name is associated with the Goddess worshipped by those that follow the Eve Faith, a monotheistic religion that believes in a "Goddess Eve," the Primal Soul who created the Souls in her image and disappeared sometime after guiding the world's first Souls, much to her disappointment and chagrin.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Tablet of Fate":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tablet_of_Destinies_(mythic_item)][/i].

title: erusha_(eversoul)
body:
An Undead-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: [[Jang Ye-na]] (Korean) | [[Shiraishi Haruka (voice actor)|]] (Japanese)
[hr]
A belly dancer contracted under the Arkenine-based talent agency Bestie Production, owned by the eccentric songwriter [[Onyx_(eversoul)|]]. Has a tendency to get very chatty and may even speak at a faster rate than the average Soul.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Vajra":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vajra][/i].

title: erika_(eversoul)
body:
A Fairy-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Kim Ga-ryung (Korean) | [[Kubo Yurika]] (Japanese)
[hr]
A genius alchemist running an atelier in Arkenine, with sponsorship from [[Jade_(eversoul)|]]'s Merchants' Guild. Her concocted potions are second to none, but the same cannot be said about her socialization prowess. She's rather withdrawn and prone to overthinking her actions in public, but she reveals her true self once one starts talking about the children's show "Professor Teddy" with her.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Elixir of Life":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elixir_of_life][/i].

title: eileen_(eversoul)
body:
A Humanlike-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Son Seon-yeong (Korean)
[hr]
The infamous guild leader of Spades, the most notorious thieves' guild in the Kingdom of Troyca. Her penchant for thieving and gambling masks the reason why she established the guild in the first place: to seek out a volatile magical gem called the Void Crystal and destroy it before it gets another chance to become destructive enough to erase whole buildings and Souls alike.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Harpe":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harpe][/i].

title: edith_(eversoul)
body:
A Fairy-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Kim Sung-hee (Korean)
[hr]
Once the second princess of the Tabrian Empire, she left her life of royalty behind after being entranced by the gentle kindness of Solrey's Queen [[Yuria_(eversoul)|]] during one of her visits to Tabria. Nowadays, she works as deputy commander of the Order of Blackhawk under the leadership of Commander [[Linzy_(eversoul)|]]. She appears regal and composed at first glance, but her previous life of luxury has left her unable to take care of herself in things like housework and daily routines. She's learning, but she still has a long way to go before she can really call herself an independent woman and stop receiving constant letters from Crown Princess [[Hazel_(eversoul)|]]...

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Balisarda":[https://en.namu.wiki/w/%EB%B0%94%EB%A6%AC%EC%82%AC%EB%8B%A4][/i].

title: dora_(eversoul)
body:
A Humanlike-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Kim Yea-lim (Korean) | Tanaka Takako (Japanese)
[hr]
A Fayren Forest Keeper with a deep attachment to anything bear-related. Having been essentially raised by forest bears upon her first awakening in Eden, she adores all kinds of bears and wants to meet one of each bear at least once in her long lifetime, currently working as a Forest Keeper to gather travel funds to go to Chalar to meet polar bears. Alongside her adoration for bears is her self-made martial arts style of "Bearjutsu," a fighting style that has her fight in the frontlines as if she were a bear herself.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Bowl of Goldilocks":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goldilocks_and_the_Three_Bears][/i].

title: galbaldy_alpha
body:
A fictional manned giant combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]MS-17 Galbaldy α[/b]

A [[Zeon]] modified version of the [[Gyan]] [[mobile_suit|MS]], made with the [[Gelgoog]]'s innovations in mind, such as the potent [[beam rifle]] it carried. Not many were produced and most were captured by the [[Earth Federation]] at the end of [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]], where they would be significantly modified into the [[Galbaldy Beta]].

title: dominique_(eversoul)
body:
A Fairy-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Kim Chae-rin (Korean)
[hr]
She is the current queen of the Kingdom of Troyca, a wealthy nation dominated by merchants and aristocrats. Before becoming queen however, she was a simple commoner that wanted to learn as much as she could under educational policies established by the former Troycan queen only known by the title of "The Queen of All Things," only for said queen to gain an interest in Dominique, giving her the right to succeed her should anything happen to her. Following the Queen of All Things's death and pending resurrection after losing her life during a major Gate incident around 50 years before the events of the game, Dominique became queen despite protests from the aristocracy. In spite of her crippling social anxiety and rampant opposition from the wealthy, she wishes to narrow the gap between the rich and the poor by creating more robust policies in commerce and education, with support from [[Jade_(eversoul)|]]'s Merchants' Guild, the most powerful merchant group in Eden.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Rhongomyniad":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rhongomyniad][/i].

title: catherine_(radiance)_(eversoul)
body:
A Chaotic-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]]. This alternate version of [[Catherine_(eversoul)|]] is based on plot advancement from Chapter 7, [spoiler]being a fusion of her and [[Rose_(eversoul)|]][/spoiler].
CV: Lee Ji-yeong (Korean)
[hr]
[spoiler]Shortly after becoming Regent of Solrey due to Queen [[Yuria_(eversoul)|]]'s disappearance and subsequent reawakening as the harbinger of the apocalypse Apollyon, she wore a prototype version of the Crown of the Sun, a powerful magitech device capable of maintaining Solrey's healthy and bountiful lands in exchange for the wearer's mana. However, as Catherine is a normal Humanlike-type compared to Yuria's more powerful Angel-type, the crown started to consume her very soul, causing a mysterious dark entity to encroach upon her heart and start to corrupt her. Luckily, she was saved because of Rose fusing her own ANIMA into the crown to stabilize her existence. This led to the creation of Eden's first Chaotic-type Soul, giving Catherine the power over sacred flames in tandem with her power to protect others with her shielding magic. However, this also led to Rose's soul becoming trapped within the crown itself, leaving her physical body in a vegetative state. Now, Catherine must find a way to survive the encroaching apocalypse if she wants to find a way to bring Rose back to the material world...[/spoiler]

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Holy Shroud":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shroud_of_Turin] of Splendid Radiance[/i].

title: magnus_the_red
body:
[[Warhammer 40K]] character. [[Primarch]] of the XVth [[adeptus astartes|Legiones Astartes]], the [[Thousand Sons]].

Magnus usually relied on his immense psychic power for battle, but was equipped with regular weaponry. He was typically seen wielding a massive [[Khopesh]] known as the [[Blade of_Ahn Nunurta]] and an energy weapon dubbed the Psyfire Serpenta. He wore an [[Ornate armor|ornate]] suit of [[Power Armor]] with many [[Engraved armor|engravings]] and wardings known as the Horned Raiment. By the 41st Millennium, the Daemon Primarch Magnus was equipped with the [[Blade of Magnus]] and the [[Crown of the Crimson King]].

title: lambdadelta
body:
Character from [[Umineko no Naku Koro ni]]. [[Witch]] of Certainty. Able to kill anyone with 100% certainty.

"Lambdadelta" (λδ) represents thirty-four when using Greek numerals. The characters "mi" and "yo" can be written as the numbers three and four.

She has [[red eyes]], [[small breasts]], and [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with bangs. She wears a [[pink hat|pink]] [[beret]] with [[red bow|red]] [[hat bow]]s, a [[hair bow]], [[pearl necklace]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], a [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[pink dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] & [[dress bow]], [[jack-o'-lantern]] ornament, [[striped socks|striped]] [[pink socks|pink]] & [[white socks|white]] [[kneehighs]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[high heels]].

title: kuroe_(madoka_magica)
body:
A character in the [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]] anime only. A Magical Girl who lives in Takarazaki City. She fights with [[Tamaki Iroha]] against witches from time to time. Starting off as acquaintances but soon develop a close friendship.

h4. Appearance

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] stylized with [[sidelocks]] & [[swept bangs]]. She usually wears a [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[black dress|black]] [[dress]], [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]], and [[red riobbon|red]] [[neck ribbon|neck]] [[ribbon]]. However, as a [[magical girl]] she wears a [[hooded cloak|hooded]] [[black cloak|black]] [[cloak]], [[capelet]], [[crop top]] showing her [[midriff]]/[[navel]], a [[frilled skirt]], [[pink thighhighs]], and [[sandals]].

title: re_monster
body:
After his unfortunate death, Tomokui Kanata has been reincarnated as a member of the weakest race, a goblin named Rou. However, Rou has retained his previous life's memories, as well as an ability that allows him to gain strength and abilities from eating. He also possesses a unique evolutionary tree. Now, Rou has made a promise to himself that he would live this life to the fullest. In this alternate world of survival of the fittest, events unfold with competent subordinates and comrades. - A long-awaited survival fantasy by Komikaraizu! An anime television series adaptation produced by [[Studio Deen]] has been announced.

title: quartz_(arknights)
body:
[i]Quartz, mercenary. Here per the rules, reporting in.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator character in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Columbia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]August 13[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Lupo[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]173 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]2 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A self-disciplined mercenary from Columbia working with Rhodes Island.

She is very strict about work, training, schedules and always ensures to be punctual. Once she came to Rhodes Island, Quartz started to make friends and enjoy hobbies such as cooking with [[Cutter (arknights)|]], reading comic books with [[Heavyrain (arknights)|]] and following fashion trends with [[Utage (arknights)|]].

Her motif is based on the gray wolf.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Aida Rikako]] (Japanese), Jen Zhang (Chinese), Elizabeth Maxwell (English), and Kim Yoon-chae (Korean). Her art designer is [[five-fall]].

h4. Apperance

To request; to beg; to ask.

title: imai_lisa
body:
The bassist of [[roselia_(bang_dream!)|Roselia]] in [[BanG Dream!]]. She is a second-year high school student with [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]], [[green eyes]] and a [[:3]] smile. Her interests include [[gyaru]] fashion and [[amigurumi (medium)|]].

Lisa is childhood friends with bandmate [[Minato Yukina]], and friends with [[Aoba Moca]], who works with her at a convenience store.

Her birthday is August 25th.

Originally, her seiyuu was [[Endou Yurika]]. When Endou Yurika retired from the entertainment industry in 2018, [[Nakashima Yuki]] (who also has a [[:3]] smile) became her seiyuu.

title: hato_moa
body: Artist, illustrator, mangaka. Best known as the creator of [[Hatoful Kareshi]].

title: hatoful_kareshi
body:
Japanese title: はーとふる彼氏 ~希望の学園と白い翼~ ([i]Hātoful[Haatoful] Kareshi: Kibou no Gakuen to Shiroi Tsubasa[/i])
English version title: Hatoful Boyfriend

Translates into [i]Pigeon Boyfriend[/i]. Created by [[Hato Moa]]. An otome game wherein the player takes on the role of [[Tousaka Hiyoko]], a girl who attends a school consisting entirely of birds. A demo was released in 2011 by doujin circle PigeoNation Inc. and the full game was released in 2012 with an English version, and a high-definition remake was released in 2014.

h4. Characters

title: mario_tennis_(nintendo_64)
body: The second [[Mario Tennis]] game, released in 2000 on the [[Nintendo 64]]. It is the first to be developed by Camelot Software Planning, who would become the main developer of the series.

title: body_modification
body:
When a character's body or body parts is altered in some way that their functionality is improved or altered, such as increased muscle mass or an addition of cybernetic parts.

Commonly seen in the namesake fetish where a character's body was modified into a "living sex toy/onahole".

h4. See also
* [[amputee]]
* [[breast expansion]]
* [[cyborg]]

title: pachinko
body:
A Japanese [[gambling]] game machine similar to [[pinball]], but with several pegs and catchers, enabling players to win more [[pachinko ball]]s for later play and/or in exchange for prizes. Some pachinko machines have digital [[slot machine]]s to multiply winnings.

h4. Further reading:
* "Wikipedia: Pachinko":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pachinko]

title: slot_machine
body:
A coin-operated gaming/[[gambling]] machine that generates random combinations of symbols on a dial, certain combinations winning varying amounts of money for the player. The jackpot combination is usually [[777]].

h4. See also
* [[Pachinko]]

title: amiba
body:
[b]Amiba[/b] is a minor villain from [[Hokuto no Ken]]. He is an impostor of [[Toki (hokuto no ken)|]] who took on his name after the latter was imprisoned by [[Raoh (hokuto no ken)|]]'s forces. He then used Toki's fame as a doctor to extort wastelander to "cure" their illness with his botched imitation of Toki's [i]Hokuto Uchou Ken[/i] technique.

He has gained recurring memetic popularity in Japan due to a series of reader's fanfics on the magazine [[Fanroad]] that involves him appeared in various other anime he is completely unrelated to.

title: fanroad
body:
A Japanese anime and entertainment magazine. It uses a [[platypus]] as its [[mascot]] character.
Since its first issue in 1980, it has gone through cancellation, revival and a change of name and publishing company. However, throughout all this, "Hamamatsu Katsuki":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%B5%9C%E6%9D%BE%E5%85%8B%E6%A8%B9] has remained the chief editor. He is also known by the pen name " 'K' of Initial Biscuit", and is famous for creating the word [[kaneda_shoutarou_(tetsujin_28-gou)|Shoutarou]] complex, the origin of the Japanese slang word "[[shota|shotakon]]".

This magazine is known for its bunch of "From Readers" pages packed with weird parodies, a few of which still survive today as [[meme|memes]].
The most famous of these running gags is the following: [[Amiba]] from [[Hokuto no Ken]] appears in fanmade anime/manga dictionaries that are completely unrelated to him, and schemes to steal the glory of the top entry in the "gojuuon kana ordering":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goj%C5%ABon] list. However, he fails every time.
In addition, hardcore readers have their own jargon they use frequently. The most popular of these is "Roadists", the name they call themselves, and "gegebo", which means "to be astonished by incredibly, wretchedly, pathetic things."

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article (JP)":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%83%95%E3%82%A1%E3%83%B3%E3%83%AD%E3%83%BC%E3%83%89]

title: kagerou_project
body:
The [b]Kagerou Project[/b] is a series of songs by the [[Vocaloid]] song producer Shizen no Teki-P, or "Jin":[https://vocaloid.fandom.com/wiki/Jin]. There have been twelve songs uploaded to [[NicoNico|Nico Nico Douga]] and four songs exclusively for the album Mechanical City Days. A light novel series, titled [i]Kagerou Days[/i], was released and lasted for 13 volumes. A manga by the same name was published monthly on Comic Gene, illustrated by "Satou Mahiro":[https://kagerouproject.fandom.com/wiki/Mahiro_Satou]. An anime adaption by [[Shaft (company)|]] premiered in April 2014 titled "[[Mekakucity Actors]]", with a movie adaptation in 2016 called "Kagerou Daze -in a day's-".

title: jun'you_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light carrier [i]Jun'you[/i]. Character design by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Ootsubo Yuka]].

She is portrayed with [[long_hair|long]] feathered-[[spiked_hair|spiked]] [[purple hair]], [[purple eyes]], [[large breasts]], and her flame color is purple.

Her uniform is similar to her sister Hiyou's: a white-red [[blouse]] over a [[red shirt|red]] [[dress shirt]], [[magatama]], [[red pants|red]] [[hakama pants]], and [[platform footwear]]. For their flight decks, they both use [[scroll|scrolls]], the airplanes are [[shikigami]], controlling them as [[onmyouji]]. They also emit colored flames with text reading "Imperial Edict".

Considered to be the "Hard Drinking Party Girl":http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HardDrinkingPartyGirl of the game and one of the drunkards in the fleet. Her catchphrase (and nickname) is "[i][b]Hyahaaah![/b][/i]", which sounds like what random outlaws in [[Hokuto no Ken]] would say.  Because of this, she is sometimes referred to as the "End of the Century Carrier".

title: hiyou_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light carrier [i]Hiyou[/i]. Character design by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Ootsubo Yuka]].

She is portrayed with [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]] in a [[hime cut]] with [[hair_ribbon|hair ribbons]], [[purple eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. Her hakama is cut as a skirt and her flame color is pink.

Her uniform consists of a white [[blouse]] with red trimmings over a red [[dress shirt]] for the top, reminiscing their past as army-subsidized ocean liners, and a [[magatama]]. The bottom is a wide red [[hakama skirt]] trimmed to calf-length. They wear platform shoes. For their flight decks, they both use [[scroll|scrolls]], the airplanes are [[shikigami]], controlling them as [[onmyouji]]. They also emit colored flames with text reading "Imperial Edict".

title: chemistry
body:
A branch of [[science]] involving the composition, properties, and behaviors of physical matter. Most prominent in the field is the study of atoms - how they bind together to make one substance, and then interact with other atoms to make a new substance. The word [i]chemistry[/i] is directly borrowed from the word [i][[alchemy]][/i].

Use this tag for posts explaining or depicting the topic of chemistry, chemical experiments, etc.. Not simply due to the presence of identifiable [[chemicals|chemical]] substance.

title: measuring_cylinder
body:
A measuring cylinder, also known as a graduated cylinder or mixing cylinder, is a piece of [[laboratory]] equipment used to measure the volume of a liquid. It has a narrow cylindrical shape with lines marking the amount of liquid that has been poured.

body: The main protagonist of [[Yu-Gi-Oh! SEVENS]] and one of the returning character in [[Yu-Gi-Oh! GO RUSH!!]].

title: kirishima_roa
body: Roa Kirishima (霧島 ロア Kirishima Roa), known in the Englihs dub as "Roa Kassidy", is one of the seven main characters in the [[Yu-Gi-Oh! SEVENS]] anime. He is the leader of RoaRomin, the band he and his cousin [[Kirishima Romin|Romin]] play in, as well as one of [[Ohdo Yuga|Yuga]]'s rivals.

title: kirishima_romin
body: Romin Kirishima (霧島 ロミン Kirishima Romin), known in the English dub as "Romin Kassidy", is one of the seven main characters in the [[Yu-Gi-Oh! SEVENS]] anime. She is [[Ohdo Yuga]]'s classmate, and a talented student and sportswoman who is the guitarist of RoaRomin, the Elementary School Band. Romin originally befriended Yuga and his friends with the intention of spying on them for her cousin, [[Kirishima Roa]].

title: kamijou_tatsuhisa
body: Tatsuhisa Kamijo (上城 龍久  Kamijō Tatsuhisa), nicknamed Luke (ルーク Rūku), known in the English dub as "Lucidian Kallister", is one of the seven main characters in the [[Yu-Gi-Oh! SEVENS]] anime. He is one of [[Ohdo Yuga]]'s best friends and rivals, and schoolmate from the next class over, and the self-proclaimed number one Duelist at Goha #7 Elementary. He is also the younger brother to [[Kamijou Haruka]].

title: welt_yang
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]] who originated from the [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] timeline. Voiced by [[Hosoya Yoshimasa]] in Japanese. 

He has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[yellow eyes]], and wears [[glasses]]. His default outfit in Star Rail consists of a [[black shirt|black undershirt]], [[double-breasted]] [[white shirt]], [[grey jacket]], [[black pants]], [[grey scarf]], and [[black footwear|black]] leather shoes. His main weapon is a copy of the 9th Divine Key Star of Eden that he replicates using his Reason powers, taking the form of a cane. 
 
A seasoned member of the [[Astral Express (honkai: star rail)|]] crew and the former sovereign of Anti-Entropy who has saved Earth from annihilation, having inherited the name of the world "Welt". He is the second Herrscher of Reason from his world, having found himself and [[Void Archives]] in the Star Rail world-cluster after the events of the Alien Space manga. 


h4. Appearance

* !post #7689883: Splash art (featuring Void Archives, Tesla, Einstein, and Joyce)
* !post #8768316: In the Name of the World (signature Light Cone)

title: smiley_face
body:
A symbol of the 1970s, along with the peace sign. It is a stylized [[smile|smiling]] face drawn as a yellow circle with two black dots and a black arc representing eyes and a mouth. 

Don't confuse a smiley face with an [[emoticon]] or [[emoji]].

h4. Example

title: gundam_seed
body:
[b]Mobile Suit Gundam Seed[/b] is a [[mecha]] anime TV series that spans fifty episodes, which broadcasted in Japan from October 5, 2002 to September 27, 2003 on the JNN TV stations TBS and MBS. It has mecha designs by [[Ookawara Kunio]] and character designs by [[Hirai Hisashi]].

Gundam Seed takes place in an alternate universe (Cosmic Era) and is constantly compared to the first series, [[Mobile Suit Gundam]], which occur in the year 0079 (Universal Century).

It is very infamous for [[derivative work|copying battle scenes]] from older [[Gundam]] series.

body:
Character from [[Aikatsu Stars!]]. She's a student at [[venus ark uniform|Venus Ark]]. She has a close resemblance to [[ashida yuuri|Ashida Yuuri]], except color-coded differently: they share the same voice actress as well in [[Koga Aoi]]. She's from [[Hungary]]: her name is most likely derived from the Hungarian composer [[Franz Liszt]]. 

Due to her being Hungarian, her naming order is similar to the Japanese one: her surname is Liszt and her given name is Juli (pronounced as yoo-lee).

title: aikatsu!
body:
An arcade collectible card game developed by Bandai company, launched in October 2012. It is adapted into an anime by Sunrise, began airing from October 8, 2012. A Nintendo 3DS game was released on November 15, 2012.

The series takes place at Starlight Academy (スターライト学園), a prestigious school with both middle school and high school divisions, where girls train to become idols and take part in various auditions. To participate in these auditions, players use Aikatsu cards, special cards which contain digitalised dresses and accessories from various manufacturers. How well they succeed is often dependent on choosing the right combination of cards. The video games cast players in the role of a new student, who must train to become an idol and reach the top.

The anime series follows [[Hoshimiya Ichigo]], who idolizes the top star [[Kanzaki Mizuki]] and decides to enroll in Starlight Academy together with her best friend [[Kiriya Aoi]]. Not long after, Ichigo and Aoi become close with [[Shibuki Ran]], one of their classmates. Together, the trio train for auditions and aim to become top idols.

title: luocha_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A [[Honkai: Star Rail]] character. 

A foreign trader who came from beyond the seas appearing in the Xianzhou Luofu with a huge [[coffin]]. With his consummate medical skills, he always rescues people in times of danger. Voiced by [[Ishida Akira (voice actor)|]] in Japanese.

He is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[green eyes]]. His outfit consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white jacket]] worn over a [[black shirt]], [[white pants]], [[black gloves]], green [[armband]] to his left sleeve, and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #7690432: Base art

h4. See also
* [[Otto Apocalypse]] and [[Void Archives]] - his [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] counterparts.
** Specifically, "Luocha" is the Chinese term used that equates to "Raksha", one of the nicknames given to Otto.

title: otto_apocalypse
body:
A [i][[Honkai Impact 3rd]][/i] character. Voiced by [[Ishida Akira (voice Actor)|]] (regular) and [[Ogata Megumi]] (young). 

He is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] tied to a [[low ponytail]], and [[green eyes]]. His default outfit consists of a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[black shirt]] worn under a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white jacket]], [[white pants]], [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]], [[red sash]], and a [[cross]] dangling from his jacket.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6133088: Reference sheet

h4. Background
[expand]
The son of Nikolas Apocalypse and Sabrina Schariac, Otto was born in 1452 as a member of House Apocalypse. During his childhood, he met [[Kallen Kaslana]] and deemed her as his only friend, vowing together to save the world against the threat of the Honkai. When Kallen's father died for fighting the Honkai, Otto later discovered the 1st Divine Key, Void Archives into hopes of bringing back her late father, which he ended up reconsidering as her father's sacrifice will be in vain. This Divine Key would later assist him in his later goals.

Afterwards in his adulthood, Otto became the next Overseer of Schicksal (specifically the 227th), securing the position for the next 500 years in his own callous obsession of finding ways to revive Kallen. In one of his cloning attempts, he created [[Theresa Apocalypse]] and would later adopt her as his granddaughter.
[/expand]

h4. See also
* [[Void Archives]] - related HI3 character.
* [[Luocha (Honkai: Star Rail)|]] - his [[Honkai: Star Rail]] counterpart.
other_names: オットー・アポカリプス

title: void_archives
body:
[[Honkai Impact 3rd]] non-playable character.

The Divine Key made from the core of the Previous Era's Herrscher of Reason and thus capable of creating replicas of weapons. Originally a gold cube, it fell into the hands of [[Otto Apocalypse]], and took control of one of his Soulium bodies after his death. In the latter form, it was responsible for bringing the Sky People to Earth and causing the St. Fountain Incident depicted in A Post-Honkai Odyssey.

Its subsequent status is unknown, but given its appearance in [[Welt Yang]]'s [[Honkai: Star Rail]] official art (post #5615313) and Welt having flashbacks of it upon seeing [[Luocha (Honkai: Star Rail)|]], its future return is likely. 

h4. See also
* [[Otto Apocalypse]] - related HI3 character.
* [[Luocha (Honkai: Star Rail)|]] - his [[Honkai: Star Rail]] counterpart.

title: yahagi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Yahagi[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Yamada Yuuki (voice actor)|]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]] with a red [[scrunchie]] and has notable [[sidelocks]] and [[red eyes]]. Her default outfit is her class' uniform: a [[sleeveless]] [[serafuku]] that exposes her [[midriff]], [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]], dark [[blue necktie]], [[white gloves]], [[black belt]], [[rudder footwear]], and [[asymmetrical legwear]] where the left leg has a [[single thighhigh]] stocking on a [[garter_straps|garter strap]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and foremast to her back, two hull pieces containing her three real-life 15.2 twin gun mounts with a [[joystick]] control, an 8 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]] mount on her right [[rudder footwear|rudder boot]], and her [[flight deck]] on the left boot. 

She speaks in a serious tone, with militaristic terminology. She has a line about enjoying [[Sasebo]] burgers (named after her hometown) as an uncharacteristic soft side to her. While she acts mature around her sisters, she tends to play an awed junior to (or romantic interest to) [[Yamato (Kancolle)|]].

The historical [i]Yahagi[/i] was sunk a couple months before the end of the war in the ill-fated [[Operation Ten-gou]], a suicide mission which sank [[Yamato (Kancolle)|]] and virtually everyone else involved. Because of this, she almost always appears either with Yamato, her sister ships, or guarding destroyers.

title: seppuku
body:
Also known as hara-kiri, a form of ritual [[suicide]] by [[disembowelment]]. Primarily practiced by the [[samurai]], seppuku was used to die with honor rather than falling into the hands of an enemy, as a means of punishment for serious offenses, as a means of protest against a lord's decision, or to atone for dishonor, such as a shameful deed or a failure to protect one's lord.

It was performed by the samurai using a tanto or wakizashi to cut open one's belly from left to right in a slicing motion, at which point the [[kaishakunin]], the samurai's second, had the job of finishing the job by beheading him before he could show any sign of pain or loss of composure.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Seppuku":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seppuku]

body: The personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Shirayuki[/i] in [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]]. She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair]] in [[short_twintails|short]] [[low twintails]] with [[parted bangs]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit, the Special-Type uniform, is a [[serafuku]] comprising a [[white shirt]], [[blue sailor collar]], [[neckerchief]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnel and foremast carried as a form of backpack, while carrying two 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap|thigh straps]] and a 12.7 twin gun mount Type A as a [[handgun]]. In real life, [i]Shirayuki[/i] was part of DesDiv11 and saw action in the battles of Sunda Strait, [[battle of Midway|Midway]], and Naval Guadalcanal. She was sunk in the battle of the Bismarck Sea on March 3rd, 1943 near Papua New Guinea. [[Shikinami (Kancolle)|]] rescued her survivors. h4. title: uranami_(kancolle)
body: The personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Uranami[/i] in [[Kantai Collection]]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied to a side [[single braid]], and [[brown eyes]]. Although she is listed as a Special Type I (Fubuki-class) destroyer, she is actually of an intermediary design between the Types I and II, with the funnels of the later type but with the guns of the earlier type. As such, she wears a variant of the "basic" uniform: a blue-and-white short-sleeved [[serafuku]] but with a brown collar (blue sailor collar) and a brown [[neckerchief]] characteristic of Shibafu's Ayanami-class. She completes the set with a blue [[pleated skirt]], [[black_socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and a [[red ribbon]] on her braid. Her [[rigging]] consists of a funnel-mast backpack set, two 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s, and a 12.7 cm twin mount as a [[handgun]]. Her official art also has her swinging an [[anchor]] in her left hand. She has a similar "forthright energetic" personality to [[Fubuki (Kancolle)|]], although with a somewhat more [[tomboy]]ish edge. She also has a strong respect for/dependency upon her sister-ship, [[Isonami (kancolle)|]], referring to her or asking for help from her whenever she is in trouble. She similarly has a strong attachment to her other historic division-mates, [[Ayanami (kancolle)|]] and [[Shikinami (kancolle)|]]. The real-life [i]Uranami[/i] was part of DesDiv 19 with sister-ships [i]Isonami[/i], [i]Ayanami[/i], and [i]Shikinami[/i]. During the [[Battle of Midway]], they were on escort duty, and [i]Uranami[/i] and [i]Isonami[/i] collided. She spent most of the war as an escort or a transport destroyer, and was eventually sunk in the [[Battle of Leyte Gulf]] in October 1944 alongside [[Kinu (Kancolle)|]]. h4. title: lapels
body:
Lapels are the folded flaps of cloth on the front of a [[blazer]], [[suit jacket|suit]] [[jacket]]s or [[coat]]. Usually they are formed by folding over the front edges of the jacket or coat and sewing them to the collar, an extra piece of fabric around the back of the neck.

title: nose_hook
body:
A special type of hook that is hooked under the nostrils then used to pull the nose upwards.

From the Yuribou Hentai Dictionary:

顔面攻撃 (ganmen kōgeki), lit. "face attack". A variation on S/M play in which the captive girl's face is contorted to make it look ugly so she is embarrassed and feels dominated, and the men feel domineering and virile. Commonly used are fingers in nostrils or mouth, or retractor devices, attached to a headpiece or collar, which hold open the mouth or nostrils. The nose-specific version is called "hana-zeme" (鼻責め "nose play"), and the retractor devices for it are "hana hukku" (鼻フッウ "nose hook").

title: type_11_light_machine_gun
body:
The first [[light machine gun]] to be mass-produced for the [[Imperial Japanese Army]]. The weapon is easily distinguished by its open-topped ammunition hopper, which was also the weapon's greatest defect: allowing dirt and mud to easily infiltrate the gun, leading to jams. This gave the gun a poor reputation amongst Japanese soldiers, and calls to fix it led to the Type 11's successor, the [[Type 96 light machine gun]].

title: snowbell_(flower)
body:
[b][i]Leucojum[/i][/b], commonly known as snowbell or snowflake, is a genus of [[flower]]ing plants in the family [i]Amaryllidaceae[/i]. There are only two species, the summer [i]Leucojum aestivum[/i] and the spring [i]Leucojum vernum[/i].

Snowbells produce [[white flower|white]], nodding, bell-shaped flowers. The flowers are six-petaled with a green or yellow spot at the tip of each petal. [i]Leucojum vernum[/i] usually produces one (rarely two) flowers per stem, while [i]Leucojum aestivum[/i] produces three, five or seven. Each flower grows on a separate stem called a pedicel, which is attached to the main stem. Each pedicel ends in a distinctive bulb-like outer (inferior) ovary to which the flower is attached.

Not to be confused with [[snowdrop (flower)|]], which has the same color and spots, and [[lily of the valley]], which has the same color and shape. The flowers of the former have three long outer petals and three much shorter inner petals, while the flowers of the latter have no spots and no bulb-like outer ovaries to which the flowers are attached.

h4. Examples

* !asset #21737370: Flowers: [i]Leucojum aestivum[/i]

title: daffodil
body:
[b][i]Narcissus[/i][/b], commonly called daffodil, is a genus of [[flower]]ing plants in the family [i]Amaryllidaceae[/i]. The scientific name of the plant is often linked to the myth of [[Narcissus]], who became so obsessed with his [[narcissism|own reflection]] in water that he drowned, although it is not clear whether the flower was named after the myth or the myth after the flower. The other common name is jonquil, after a particular species of the family.

Daffodil flowers grow at about a right angle to the stem and have a cup- or trumpet-shaped protruding center surrounded by 6 petal-like tepals (undifferentiated petals and sepals). The flowers may come in a limited variety of colors, most often white and yellow, sometimes orange. Depending on the species, the tepals may be a different color than the center.

In the east, they are considered a symbol of wealth and good fortune, and since they bloom in early spring are often associated with the Chinese New Year. The bulbs are mildly poisonous and must be handled with care but were once a part of traditional Japanese medicine.

title: onbashira
body:
[[Yasaka Kanako]]'s logs. The Onbashira are sacred logs that are used, after being cut using special ceremonial tools, in renewal of the Suwa Grand Shrine that occurs every six years, the ceremony which has gone uninterrupted for 1200 years. There are used in two festivals, Yamadashi and Satobiki. Yamadashi uses large trees that are covered in red and white regalia and covered in ropes. Part of this includes the ceremony on "Ki-Otoshi" which involves young men riding onbashira down steep slopes to prove their manhood.

Satobiki involves the ceremonial placement of onbashira in the foundations of the Suwa Grand Shrine, with a ceremonial group of log bearers that ride the log as its being raised and sing from the top of the log to signify that it has been raised.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Onbashira":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Onbashira

title: spider_lily
body:
A poisonous [[flower]] (species [i]Lycoris radiata[/i]) commonly associated with death. 

A spider lily has 4-6 flowers growing from a central leafless stem, forming a sort of dome. Natural colors include red (most common), pink, [[White spider lily|white]] and [[Yellow spider lily|yellow]], sometimes depicted in non-existent black and [[Blue spider lily|blue]]. The most noticeable features are the long stamens, which give it a distinct entangled/spidery look, earning its common English name 'Spider Lily'. 

Its Japanese name is "[i]Higan-bana[/i]" ("[i]Higan[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Higan flower) or "[i]Manjushage[/i]". It blooms without leaves and bears leaves without flowers, which is why it is also known in Japan as 葉見ず花見ず ([i]ha-mizu, hana-mizu[/i]), roughly translated as "without seeing leaves, without seeing flowers".

Not to be confused with [[chrysanthemum]], some species of which have long and thin outer petals that can resemble spider lily stamens.

h4. Examples

body:

It is a former human whose bad memories were extracted corrupting their mind in the process. Mostly savage and murderous but still capable of logical thinking.

h4. External links
* "Corrupted Souls | Rusty Lake Wiki | Fandom":[https://rusty-lake.fandom.com/wiki/Corrupted_Souls]

title: rosemary_(herb)
body:
An evergreen herb (Rosmarinus officinalis) of the [i]Lamiaceae[/i] (mint) family, native to the Mediterranean region, with clusters of small, light-blue flowers and leaves that yield a fragrant essential oil, used in perfumes and cooking.

h4. Other Lamiaceae species
* [[Deadnettle]]
* [[Lavender (flower)|]]
* [[Mint]]
* [[Salvia (flower)|]]

h4. See also
* [[Statice]], also called marsh rosemary

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Rosemary":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rosemary
* "Wikipedia: Lamiaceae":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lamiaceae

title: kamen_rider_dark_kiva
body:
[i]"This is my proclamation as king, rejoice"[/i]
―King issuing his death warrant

The Checkmate Four's original [b]King[/b] ([b]キング[/b] Kingu) was referred to as the first [b]Dark Kiva[/b] ([b]闇のキバ[/b] Yami no Kiba), the lord of all Fangires and the original Kiva who was a threat to humanity in his time. He was also known as the [b]Bat Fangire[/b] ([b]バットファンガイア[/b] Batto Fangaia), with his true name being The Dawn Sleeps, A Magnificent Story's Ending (暁が眠る、素晴らしき物語の果て Akatsuki ga Nemuru, Subarashiki Monogatari no Hate). He was from the Beast Class of the Fangire subclass.
other_names: 仮面ライダーダークキバ

title: kivat-bat_ii
body:
A mechanical-looking [[bat (animal)|]] from the television series [[Kamen Rider Kiva (series)|Kamen Rider Kiva]].

Formerly a part of the Checkmate Four's treasure in 1986, helping the King fight as [[Kamen Rider Dark Kiva|Dark Kiva]]. He arrived in 2008 and used [[Otoya Kurenai]] (much to the fact that he died after abusing its power) and [[Nobori Taiga]] (formerly [[Kamen Rider Saga]]).

It is then revealed in the series that he is the father of [[Kivat-Bat III]].

Voiced by [[Sugita Tomokazu]], who also voices Kivat-Bat III.

title: mutsuki_face_(blue_archive)
body:
A [[meme]] based on a screenshot of a 3D model of [[Mutsuki_(blue_archive)|]] from [[Blue Archive]] that emphasizes her round face with a smug [[:3]] expression.

The model was part of a collaboration event between Blue Archive and the airsoft gun manufacturer Tokyo Marui. For this event a [[VRChat]] world was created for the online convention "Virtual Market 6":[https://vket6.v-market.work/en] featuring various models of weapons and characters and a playable shooting minigame.

h4. Examples

* !asset #20310852
* !asset #20149629

h4. External links

* "Virtual Market 6: TOKYO MARUI Co., Ltd":[https://vket6.v-market.work/en/company/3]
* "DCinside.com: I took a picture of the Blue Archive corporate booth in VR Chat":[https://gall.dcinside.com/mgallery/board/view/?id=projectmx&no=717279] ("Archive.is":https://archive.is/uFcfm)
* "VRChat: TOKYO MARUI VRC Survival Game Field ＂Island＂":[https://vrchat.com/home/launch?worldId=wrld_2a05d03b-de3f-4063-96ce-3835dfb3e56f]
* "Reddit: What's the origin of this Mutsuki image?":https://www.reddit.com/r/BlueArchive/comments/wolljn/whats_the_origin_of_this_mutsuki_image_ive_seen/

title: hiyama_kiyoteru
body:
Hiyama Kiyoteru is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by AH-Software Co. Ltd., and was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. 

His appearance was illustrated by [[Umetani Atarou]]. He is designed as a young teacher. He ends up teaching mathematics to [[Kaai Yuki]]. And according to his official profile, he is part of a band called "ICE MOUNTAIN" where he plays guitar and vocals as "Ice Teru". 

He wears a standard [[suit]] with blue [[necktie|tie]], and has [[glasses]] and a blue [[headset]]. His hair is [[brown hair|brown]] and his eyes are [[black eyes|black]].

h4. See also

* [[List of VOCALOID derivatives]]

h4. External links

* "AH-Software page":http://www.ah-soft.com/vocaloid/kiyoteru/index.html
* "Official Site":http://www.ah-soft.com/index.html

title: kamen_rider_accel
body:
Secondary Rider of [[Kamen Rider W]].

[[Terui RYuu|Terui Ryu]] is a young police superintendent in charge of investigating paranormal crimes. However, he loathes his host city, and only does his job to find the "[[Isaka Shinkuro|Man]] with the [[Weather Dopant|W]] [[Gaia Memory|Memory]]", who killed his family.

Unlike [[Kamen Rider Double|Double]], Ryu only needs himself to turn into Accel, a red Rider with the ability to transform into a motorcycle. He also has the ability to transform into the blue, speed-oriented Trial Form, as well as the all-around Booster Form but only in W Returns.
other_names: 仮面ライダーアクセル

title: kamen_rider_nega_den-o
body:
The main villain of the [[Kamen Rider Den-O (series)|Kamen Rider Den-O]] & [[Kamen Rider Kiva (series)|Kiva]]: Climax Deka movie.

He is the Rider form of [[Negataros]], who looks exactly like [[Kamen Rider Den-O]] Sword Form, except that his [[peach]]-themed armor plates are colored purple with cyan tribal markings that also appear on the gloves and the boots of his Rider suit.

He only has one form called Nega Form. He can also alter the Nega DenGasher into any of Den-O's various weapons.

title: i-14_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese submarine I-14. Nicknamed "Iyo". Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Imamura Ayaka]]. 

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] with a [[asymmetrical_hair|single long strand on her right side]], and [[brown_eyes|brown]] [[tsurime]] eyes. Her default (and only) outfit is a [[school swimsuit]] shared with her sister I-13: hers has her name emblazoned over her left hip. Over this, she wears a serafuku-style [[white shirt]] with a center [[breast cutout]] and [[white sailor collar]], [[brown neckerchief]], and [[partially fingerless gloves|partially fingerless]] [[black gloves]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of [[headphones]] with a [[hat]] patterned off her real-life bow, her real-life conning tower/hangar on her left arm, and red [[rudder footwear]].

title: i-13_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese submarine I-13. Nicknamed "Hitomi". Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Imamura Ayaka]]. 

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] with a [[asymmetrical_hair|single long strand on her left side]], and [[brown_eyes|brown]] [[tsurime]] eyes. Her default (and only) outfit is a [[school swimsuit]] shared with her sister I-14: hers has her name emblazoned over her hip. Over this, she wears a serafuku-style [[white shirt]] with a center [[breast cutout]] and [[white sailor collar]], [[brown neckerchief]], and [[partially fingerless gloves|partially fingerless]] [[black gloves]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of [[headphones]] with a [[hat]] patterned off her real-life bow, her real-life conning tower/hangar on her right arm, and red [[rudder footwear]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #2628217: Default 

h4. History
The historical IJN [i]I-13[/i] had a severely short history, being commissioned only on December 16, 1944, and sunk by USS [i]Anzio[/i] on July 16, 1945 while en route to an operation. Her [[dark persona|abyssal counterpart]] ([[Abyssal Twin Princess (white)]]) is also presumed killed by the player in her final form and it references the real life I-13's fate. 

h4. Type AM submarines

* [b]I-13[/b]
* [[I-14 (Kancolle)|]]

h4. See also

* [[I-13 (Azur Lane)]]

title: hk_slap
body:
A method of releasing the charging handle from the notch of a firearm, particular ones located at the front of the weapon. This action is mainly done on firearms featuring a roller delayed blowback system, since the roller requires the bolt to travel forward with some force to properly lock.

The action is mainly associated with [[Heckler & Koch]] firearms, including the [[h&k_mp5|MP5]], the [[h&k_g3|G3]], and the [[h&k_ump|UMP]], as the manufacturer recommends this action in its operator manuals.

title: galactus
body:
A [[giant|gigantic]] [[Marvel|Marvel Comics]] villain whose favorite food is [[planet]]s and seeks to end the human race.

[b]Galactus[/b] first appeared in the comic [i]Fantastic Four[/i] #48 published in March 1966 in the United States. The character was designed and created by the legendary comics artist "Jack Kirby":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_Kirby .

He serves as the final [[video game]] boss of both [[Marvel vs. Capcom 3|Marvel vs. Capcom 3: Fate of Two Worlds]] and its Ultimate expansion.

title: perth_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s depiction of HMAS Perth (D29), drawn by [[Kusada Souta]]. HMAS Perth was one of three modified Leander-class light cruisers used by the Royal Australian Navy during the early part of [[World War II]]. She was originally called HMS Amphion before being renamed after "the capital city of the state of Western Australia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perth]. She is the game's first Australian shipgirl.

Visually, Perth has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] tied in a [[braided bun]] with a [[braid]] across the front. She wears a [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] underneath a [[green vest]] with a [[blue necktie]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[plaid skirt]], a pair of [[green thighhighs]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. Her [[machinery]] includes a pair of [[adapted turret]]s and a [[searchlight]]. She also has a [[green cape]] draped over her left shoulder, fastened by a large [[badge]] that strangely resembles the [[Icelandic flag]] and six seven-pointed stars which resemble those found on the Australian flag.

Because she is originally British, she does not exhibit the stereotypical mannerisms and preferences associated with Australians. She does make a reference to "Vegemite":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vegemite], a popular Australian sandwich spread, and is often accompanied by a [[koala]] in fan art (due to one clinging to a fairy version of her, the 6-inch Twin Rapid Fire Gun Mount Mk.XXI fairy).

She was originally commissioned for the [[Royal Navy]] on 15 June 1936 and was sold to the Royal Australian Navy in June 1939. She was sunk during the Battle of Sunda Strait on 1 March 1942.

h4. See Also
* [[list of Kantai Collection characters]]
* Her Leander-class half-sisters:
** [[Leander (Azur Lane)|]]
** [[Ajax (Azur Lane)|]]
** [[Achilles (Azur Lane)|]]

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: HMAS Perth (D29)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMAS_Perth_(D29)]
