title: traumatized
body:
A character in the process of or after experiencing some “traumatic” event (ex: betrayal, seeing [[death]], etc.) that would cause that character to experience [[PTSD]] if reminded of the experience in the future.

A possible indication of a character being traumatized is an expression of shock with [[empty eyes]] (though it is not limited to such features).

A picture tagged with this tag should show/imply the cause of the trauma and that the character has a negative reaction towards whatever event is the cause.

h4. See Also
* [[despair]]
* [[ruined for marriage]]

title: guy_tired_after_sex_(meme)
body:
A redraw [[meme]] based on a picture of a man apparently [[exhausted]] with [[sunken cheeks]] in bed while his girlfriend takes a [[selfie]] above him. Some interpreted the photo as an implication the pair had [[after sex|just had sex]]. The photo became a template with which people drew original characters and characters from pop culture in their poses.

* !asset #24740426

There is also a trend of combining this meme with other desiccated body memes, such as the [[mexico_ufo_alien_bodies_hearing_(meme)|Mexican UFO Alien]].
h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Guy Tired After Sex":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/guy-tired-after-sex

title: h.e.r.b.i.e.
body:
[b]H.E.R.B.I.E.[/b] (Humanoid Experimental Robot, B-type, Integrated Electronics) is a [[robot]] from the [[Fantastic Four]]. 

It was originally created for the 1978 Fantastic Four cartoon on NBC (now known as The New Fantastic Four) as a replacement for [[Johnny Storm]], as the character's television rights were owned by Universal Studios at the time and they were planning a live action television movie of the [[Human Torch]]. H.E.R.B.I.E. has since appeared in the comics and later adaptations.

title: fantastic_four_(1967_tv_series)
body:
1967 [[Hanna-Barbera]] cartoon based on the [[Fantastic Four]]. In Japan, it was known as "Uchuu Ninja Golmes", with the Fantastic Four being the "Uchuu Ninja Shiningumi" (宇宙忍者四人組, Space Ninja Quartet) and Golmes referring to [[Reed Richards]]' name in the dub (derived from 'gomu', referring to his rubber body, and 'Holmes'). The remaining Fantastic Four also had different names, with [[Sue Storm]] being called Susie, [[Johnny Storm]] being called Fireboy, and [[Ben Grimm]] being called Gunlock [with his catchphrase becoming 'Monsieur Muramura!', a signature of seiyuu Seki Keiroku]).

The villains were famously handled by comedians, with [[Doctor Doom]] (known here as Akuma Hakase/Dr. Demon) speaking in [[Nagoyaben]].

title: ruined_for_marriage
body:
[i]"Now I'll never be a bride..."[/i]

Refers to a stock situation where a character (conventionally female) experiences distress, because they have been in some way shamed or made 'impure,' and because of that can no longer get married.  The nature of the shame can be anything from being seduced or [[rape]]d, to being seen in [[underwear]] or [[nude]], to simply being caught in some [[embarrassed|embarrassing]] act (example: post #1282220).

This tag is appropriate when a character utters an appropriate version of the stock line "Now I can never be married..."  The situation is also frequently indicated non-verbally, through one character (the "aggressor") being shown [[smoking]] a [[after sex|post-coital]] [[cigarette]] with a satisfied expression on their face, while the other character (the "victim") is [[crying]], most often [[covering face|hiding their face]].

h4. See also

* [[after sex]]
* [[netorare]]

title: playboy_pokemon
body:
For images containing outfits that follow the general design of a [[playboy_bunny]], but designed after specific [[pokemon]]. Not exclusive to "bunny" pokemon.
Gijinka and furries of pokemon count as long as their outfit has the overall design of a playboy bunny outfit, but not if the outfit includes accesories like generic bunny ears instead of pokemon features.
In other words, images that act as an answer to: "What if the playboy bunny outfit were invented in the pokemon world, based on pokemon?"

title: falconry
body: Using a trained bird of prey to hunt small animals, or just having such a bird on one's arm. Often requires the use of a [[falconry glove]]. Though the name implies [[falcon]]s, the tag can include anything, including but not limited to [[hawk]]s, [[eagle]]s, [[harpy|harpies]], [[chimera|chimerae]], or [[airplane]]s.

body:
[i]Born in the Sunny Park full of everyone's smiles, the clover-like girl carries happiness.[/i]

An upbeat forest [[nymph|spirit]] who is heavily associated with animals. She wears a cotton [[headwreath]] and hates winter.

title: bob_2002_(pop'n_music)
body: A [[robot]] from Pop'n 9, he has a [[jetpack]] and goes [[sledding]] in his spare time. Hate [[crow]]s because they tend to peck at him while he flies.

title: sunny_(pop'n_music)
body:
[i]Hello! I've been traveling around
 the world in search of my older brother!
 But I'm happy to have made a lot of friends! [/i]

A nomadic girl traveling the world for her brother. She no longer knows where she's from or where she's going to, but she enjoys the journey.

title: kuranosuke_(pop'n_music)
body:
[i]"A young boss who aims to unify the world with one Japanese sword! Even if he looks like this, he likes banquets and his stories are interesting, so he is respected by his subordinates."[/i]

A [[yakuza]] member who is well respected by his underlings. Older than most of the [[Pop'n Music]] cast. he has many [[piercing]]s.

title: foxy_(pop'n_music)
body: A cool [[fox boy]] from the Yokohama Warehouse District. He has [[sharp teeth]] and plays the [[saxophone]].

title: papyrus_(pop'n_music)
body: An [[Anubis]]-like creature who doesn't speak in a language others can understand. He is visually associated with [[hieroglyphics]].

title: mogiki_toaka
body:
The protagonist of [[aden_(game)|Aden]]
She is a cheerful lady who defeats enemies with the power of dance, learned from her friend [[sonikami kobako|kobako]]
Whom she meets quite suddenly, crashing onto her dancing stage during a performance. 
She has no memories of her past, or why she fell from the sky.

title: base_(art)
body:
An image designed to be edited, often posted for free on websites like [[DeviantART]]. In the 2000s, pixel bases traced from anime screenshots were commonplace, featuring nude and bald anime characters that artists (especially young artists) could edit their own hair and clothes onto.

Sometimes depicted as a nostalgic reference.

h4. See also

* [[derivative work]]
* [[2000s (style)]]

title: tatsumi_koutarou
body:
The self proclaimed mysterious manager of the idol group Franchouchou in [[Zombie Land Saga]].

He has [[brown hair]], always wears [[sunglasses]] even during night time, and also wears his [[jacket on shoulders|jacket hanging on his shoulders]] and [[dried squid]] hanging off of the [[breast pocket]] of his [[red vest]]. His appearance is more or less likely based off of his voice actor, [[Miyano Mamoru]], who has made several appearances in-character within promotion.

While he generally treats the girls with a jerk-like attitude, it is made clear throughout that he does indeed care for the girls; particularly [[Minamoto Sakura|Sakura]]. In Episode 12, it is revealed that [spoiler]his real name is Inui, with strong implications that he had a crush on Sakura who was his classmate prior to her death in 2008[/spoiler].

title: aki_minoriko
body:
A [[Touhou]] character, the Stage 1 boss of [i]Mountain of Faith[/i]. Goddess of the harvest. Younger sister of [[aki_shizuha|Shizuha]]. Wears a [[hat]] with grapes on it and considered the curvier of the two sisters due to being a goddess of harvest.

h4. See also

* Touhou Wiki: http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Minoriko_Aki

title: vesta_(isekai_meikyuu_de_harem_wo)
body:
Character in [[Isekai Meikyuu de Harem wo]]. Vesta is the fourth party member and slave of [[Kaga Michio]].

Vesta is at least [[tall female|two meters tall]]. She has light [[dark skin|brown skin]], [[short hair|short]] [[red hair]], and [[red eyes]]. She has long limbs, making her look like a model. Vesta's most notable feature of her body is that her [[huge breasts|breasts are larger than her head]]. She has [[long legs]], [[thick thighs]] and [[wide hips]]. Like all [[dragon girl|dragonkin]], she has slight [[spikes|protrusions]] coming out of the outer part of her forearms. Her main outfit is a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt|white]] [[blouse]] that shows off most of her enormous bosom.

h4. External links

* "Harem in the Labyrinth of the Other World Wiki: Vesta":https://slave-harem.fandom.com/wiki/Vesta

title: otome_wa_boku_ni_koishiteru
body:
[i]Otome wa Boku ni Koishiteru[/i] (処女はお姉さまに恋してる, "The Maidens Are Falling in Love with Me"), commonly known as Otoboku (おとボク) is a visual novel developed by Caramel Box. Although the title uses the kanji for "older sister", the creators added furigana that read "boku", in order to highlight the fact the main character was actually male.

h4. See also

title: tag_group:hair_color
body:
[See [[tag groups]].]

Tags describing a character's hair color. For other characteristics of hair, see [[tag group:hair styles]].

Due to the subjective nature of color judgment and other factors such as lighting, there is an overlap between multiple different colors.

h4. Specific colors

title: atri-my_dear_moments-
body:
Atri: My Dear Moments (stylized as ATRI-My Dear Moments-) is a 2020 visual novel game developed by Frontwing and Makura (枕) who are especially known for creating [[Grisaia No Kajitsu|The Fruit of Grisaia]] visual novel, written by Asuta Konno who also wrote the [[Kono Oozora ni Tsubasa wo Hirogete|If My Heart Had Wings]] visual novel and published by Aniplex.exe, a brand of Japanese anime and music production company [[Aniplex]]. The visual novel was digitally released on Steam for Windows on June 19, 2020 worldwide. Later, on December 16, 2021, the game was also released for Android, iOS and Nintendo Switch devices by iMel only in Japan.

h4. Synopsis
In the near future, a sudden rise in sea levels floods the majority of the world and ends human civilization as we know it, forcing humanity to eke a living on what little dry land remains. [[Ikaruga Natsuki]] is a young man living under difficult circumstances in this new world. He has lost one of his legs in an accident which can only be replaced with a crude prosthetic, and he suffers constant bouts of phantom pain. One day, though, Natsuki rummages through his recently deceased grandmother's belongings to pay off a debt, only to awaken a young android girl named [[Atri]], who will go on to change his life forever

h4. External links
* Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atri:_My_Dear_Moments

title: nurikabe
body:
The nurikabe (ぬりかべ) is a youkai that manifests as a wall that impedes or misdirects walking travelers at night. It is also a binary determination puzzle named after the youkai.

It is impossible to go over or around it as it has the ability to expand itself forever. It is said the only way to get past it is to knock on it's leg or lower part. 

It's known to be more annoying than bad or scary.

h4. See also

* [[Nurikabe (gegege no kitarou)|]] ([[Gegege no Kitarou]]), one of the more famous examples.
* [[Makabe Konuri]] ([[Petopetosan]])
* [[Murikabe]] ([[Youkai watch]])
* [[Nurikabe costume]]
* [[Traditional youkai]]

title: raccoon_girl
body:
Girls with intrinsic raccoon or tanuki (raccoon-dog) features. Confusion between the two species means that characters who are meant to be tanuki girls have features more pertaining to the raccoon (like a ringed tail) and vice versa.

h4. See also

* [[raccoon]]
* [[raccoon ears]]
* [[raccoon tail]]
* [[tanuki]]

title: raccoon_tail
body:
Use this tag if a character has a [[tail]] resembling a [[raccoon]]'s or a [[tanuki]]'s.

While there are differences between a raccoon tail and a tanuki tail (raccoon tails are ringed but actual tanuki tails are tipped), they are often conflated with each other to the point where many characters who are supposed to be tanuki are depicted with ringed tails (thus, why raccoon and tanuki tails are consolidated into a single tag).

h4. See also

* [[raccoon ears]]

title: the_pillows
body:
A Japanese alternative rock band formed in 1989 in [[Hokkaido]], [[Japan]] and disbanded on January 31st 2025. The [[band (music)|]] consists of members Sawao Yamanaka (vocals and [[guitar]]), Yoshiaki Manabe (guitar), Shinichiro Sato ([[bass guitar]]), and Jun Suzuki ([[drum|drums]]).

The Pillows gained popularity in Japan in the mid-1990s with their unique blend of punk, indie rock, and pop music, and became known for their catchy hooks, energetic live performances, and Sawao Yamanaka's distinctively raspy vocals. They are perhaps best known in the West for their music featured in the anime series "[[FLCL]]" (Fooly Cooly), for which they composed and performed the entire soundtrack.

Over the years, The Pillows have released numerous albums and singles, and have become one of the most influential and respected bands in the Japanese rock scene. Their music has been described as a mix of punk rock, power pop, and garage rock, with influences mainly from British and American rock bands.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: The Pillows":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Pillows]

title: reu_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21030427
* !post #617587

Voice of [[Hakurei Reimu]] in the original [[cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆]]. Well known for her line "Puhaa~, Kyou mo ii tenki" ([i]Exhale[/i], today's weather is good too.), while holding her [[yunomi]]. Portrayed in either [[chiikorin]]'s or [[Huei Nazuki]]'s style with [[short hair with long locks|short]] [[brown hair]], [[red eyes]], and no frills on her hair bow. Often drawn [[plump]] and with [[large breasts]]. 

Got into voice acting by being friends with [[Uzuki (cookie)|]] in high school, later working with [[Alison (alison_airlines)|Alison Airlines]]. As one of the main characters of Cookie, she received a very large of both positive and negative attention. Unlike the others, she mostly accepted it and was more open with the fans about how [[Hazuna Rio]] treated her. Her weight led to many comments, with haters calling her a pig. Besides her Puhaa line, other jokes include her cosplays of [[Kagamine Rin]] being drawn as the swimsuit from [[Kagamine Len no Bousou (vocaloid)|]], and her obsession with longhorn [[beetle]]s.

She also led to three derivative characters:
* [[Sakenomi (cookie)|]]: "Kono sakenomi ga!" (You drunkard!). A chibi version of her drawn for a frame when addressing Suika. Since then has become a separate [[minigirl]] character.
* [[Reu Daikon]]: Reu's puhaa face on a [[daikon]]. Mostly a gag character, sometimes appearing with [[JOKER (cookie)|]]. Very popular in the Chinese Cookie fandom as a nudge for content to avoid the great firewall.
* [[Ru (cookie)|]]: a [[pixel art]] version that "made it to television":[https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm32824181]

title: tarot
body:
An image featuring a [[tarot card|tarot card]], or drawn to look like a tarot card.

Tarot is a set of [[card]]s originally designed to be used as [[playing card]]s, but which was later adopted by occultists as a means of divination. A typical tarot deck consists of 78 cards, divided into two groups: the Minor Arcana and the Major Arcana.

The [[minor_arcana_(tarot)|Minor Arcana]] consists of 56 cards divided into four suits: swords, wands (batons), cups, and pentacles (coins). Each suit has ten numbered cards and four court cards: Kings, Queens, Knights, and Pages.

The Major Arcana, or trump cards, consists of 22 cards without suits:

* 0. [[The Fool (tarot)|]]†
* 1. [[The Magician (tarot)|]]
* 2. [[The High Priestess (tarot)|]]
* 3. [[The Empress (tarot)|]]
* 4. [[The Emperor (tarot)|]]
* 5. [[The Hierophant (tarot)|]]
* 6. [[The Lovers (tarot)|]]
* 7. [[The Chariot (tarot)|]]
* 8. [[Justice (tarot)|]] or [[Strength (tarot)|]]‡
* 9. [[The Hermit (tarot)|]]
* 10. [[Wheel of Fortune (tarot)|]]
* 11. [[Justice (tarot)|]] or [[Strength (tarot)|]]‡
* 12. [[The Hanged Man (tarot)|]]
* 13. [[Death (tarot)|]]
* 14. [[Temperance (tarot)|]]
* 15. [[The Devil (tarot)|]]
* 16. [[The Tower (tarot)|]]
* 17. [[The Star (tarot)|]]
* 18. [[The Moon (tarot)|]]
* 19. [[The Sun (tarot)|]]
* 20. [[Judgement (tarot)|]]
* 21. [[The World (tarot)|]]

† The Fool is unnumbered and not considered a trump card in traditional decks. It may be numbered 0 or 22 in decks designed for fortune-telling.
‡ In traditional decks, Justice is the 8th card and Strength is the 11th card. Starting in the early 20th century, they swapped positions in many fortune-telling decks.
